result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Douglas Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to set up a payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Douglas Jones

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Kyle Douglas Jones appeared. Case called at 10:53 a.m. ADA McKinley recites agreement. Restitution has been paid and co defendant has made payment. Victim's Rights have been complied with. Recites agreement. Atty Caton in agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 Misd. Theft  in 15CF304. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Misd. Theft in 15CF304. Sentencing arguments. 

Crt orders:

- Misdemeanor Court Costs in the amount of $243.00. To set up a payment plan.  

- Restitution in the amount of $2,000 to be paid to Chad Flick
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.

per Defendant in court. km
Preliminary hearing at 10-05-2015 03:00 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  C. Flick.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

  Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
